title.narrative: CCCM Core Services Support for Jed'ah Camp (12,000 plots)

description.narrative:
This proposal supports core CCCM services in Jed'ah Camp in order to identify/monitor risks, map/coordinate partners, track/identify needs, and conduct capacity building trainings for CCCM staff and managers. As RNVDO is the designated camp management partner, RNVDO requests that the budget cover all of Jed'ah Camp. This amounts to 12,000 plots/households and 72,000 individuals. The costs for core services include management support costs, staff, capacity building trainings, and equipment.
Camp management, by its very nature, is multi-sectorial. The objective for CCCM is to ensure safe, dignified and livable conditions for those displaced. This objective brings together the participation and engagement of all clusters, and CCCM activities therefore the link between partners.
Reflecting this, RNVDO proposes a multi-sectorial proposal. The core activities are camp management, but the proposal brings in elements of protection and livelihoods. This proposal is also linked to a shelter proposal to ensure that Jed'ah Camp provides its residents with livable conditions (IRQ-17/3884/ST/NFIs/NGO/5623).
Bringing in other clusters ensures that IDPs will be involvement in all decisions within the camp, are given cash for work, and are empowered through self-governance activities. This will also ensure community-based approaches for PSS, child protection activities, and GBV activities. CCM staff and IDP workers will be trained in protection monitoring in order to ensure that risk factors are identified and referred to the Protection Cluster. Ultimately, these cross-cutting elements between CCCM, Emergency Livelihoods and Social Cohesion, and Protection together build into ensuring that the conditions in Jed'ah Camp are livable, dignified, and safe.
Responses within this proposal are both first and second line across all included clusters.
